ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learnt how to close read one of the foremost philosophical texts in the western cannon.

I have taken a few philosophy courses at Yale, but this was the one that had an immense impact on my writing skills. This course taught me how to write a philosophical analysis and critique at a more advanced level, compared to some other classes I have taken.  My writing is more organized and proceeds more linearly than before.
I definitely came away with a more cohesive understand ing of Kants metaphysics.
Familiarity with basic concepts of the Critique of Pure Reason. Comfort in reading and understanding Kant's writing. Argument reconstruction.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course can be improved in terms of the way the materials are presented. That is, complex themes and ideas need to be presented in such a way so as to allow students who haven't studied philosophy before or taken a few philosophy courses to be able to grasp Kant's arguments. In fact, even for philosophy majors or enthusiasts, I think it is sometimes difficult to understand what is going on in the text. Perhaps, giving more concrete examples to explain Kant's claims would enhance students' learning  and love for the material.
I thought it was very well-organized. No complaints!
Excellent pace in covering the content of the course. Helpful, informative lectures. Could benefit from more accountability for reading, like discussion or reading responses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend if you are interested in Kant's work.

I definitely would recommend this course to others. If you are looking to sharpen your analytical reasoning and critical thinking skills, then this course is your answer. If you enjoy writing papers or exploring ideas in logical steps, this course is perfect fit for you. You don't need to come with skills, just come ready and opened to discuss.
If they were very interested in Kant, absolutely!

Absolutely. I'm glad I took the time to come back to the Critique of Pure Reason, and I'm glad to have had Professor Franks's help when I did so. I've made really satisfying progress in my confidence and comprehension with the material.

extras.title: GMAN 381 01/PHIL 204 01 - Kant's Critique of Pure Reason
